intro: Hesperochiron californicus subvar. lasianthus, commonly known as the California evening primrose, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
